name: Config
info:
An input to this subflow will get the configuration to be saved to disk.

On startup, this node outputs the loaded configuration

name: Get and set variable in Global
Step 1. Reset the value of the gains
Step 2. Measure the Current Saturation Level
Get data from Pi and display them
Get UTC and Local Times and display them
Get and set variable in Global
Update and retrieve hardware_conf

name: Global Set
get config payload
body
format:
<template>
    <v-container>
      <v-row>
        <!-- First Row: Larger cards with icon centered above title -->
        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="preview"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="flat"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-eye</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Launch the Preview</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Access a real-time, high-resolution preview to inspect the contents of your current water sample.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="metadata"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-play-circle</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Start Acquisition</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Start a new acquisition process to continuously collect images and metadata from your PlanktoScope.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="/ps/data/browse/files/"
            target="_blank"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-database-search</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Explore Your Data</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Open the data explorer to review, categorize, and interpret all previously captured sample information.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>

      <!-- Second Row: Standard size cards -->
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="/ps/docs/operation/protocol-v4.pdf"
            target="_blank"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-book-open-variant</v-icon>
              Learn the Basics
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Find detailed instructions on using your PlanktoScope.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="http://pkscope-rich-kettle-10463.local/admin/grafana/d/host-summary/host-summary?orgId=1&from=now-5m&to=now&timezone=browser&var-DS_PROMETHEUS=PBFA97CFB590B2093&var-job=node-exporter&var-node=host.docker.internal:9100&var-diskdevices=%5Ba-z%5D%2B%7Cnvme%5B0-9%5D%2Bn%5B0-9%5D%2B%7Cmmcblk%5B0-9%5D%2B&refresh=5s"
            target="_blank"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-speedometer</v-icon>
              Monitoring
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Keep track of system status and performance metrics.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="calibration"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-tune</v-icon>
              Calibration
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Adjust and verify settings for consistent results.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
      
    </v-container>
</template>

name: CSS (All Pages)
Streaming
Pump MQTT Preparation
Pump
format:
<template>

    <!-- Flowrate -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="7">
        <v-slider
          v-model.number="flowrate"
          :min="min"
          :max="max"
          :step="0.2"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Flowrate"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" sm="5">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="flowrate"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="ml/min" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          v-model="flowratePreset"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          color="primary"
          variant="outlined"
          divided
          shaped
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onFlowrateToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in flowratePresets"
            :key="'flowrate-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Volume -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="8">
        <v-slider
          v-model.number="volume"
          :min="min"
          :max="max"
          :step="0.2"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Volume"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" sm="4">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="volume"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="ml" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          v-model="volumePreset"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          variant="outlined"
          color="primary"
          divided
          shaped
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onVolumeToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in volumePresets"
            :key="'volume-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Direction Control -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="direction"
          color="primary"
          mandatory
          divided
          shaped
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
        >
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'backward'">Backward</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'stop'">Stop</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'forward'">Forward</v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      min: 0.02,
      max: 30,
      flowrate: 10,
      volume: 10,
      flowratePreset: null,
      volumePreset: null,
      flowratePresets: [0.02, 0.2, 2, 20],
      volumePresets: [0.02, 2, 10, 20],
      direction: 'stop',
    };
  },
  watch: {
    flowrate(newVal) {
      this.flowratePreset = this.flowratePresets.find(val => val === newVal) ?? null;
    },
    volume(newVal) {
      this.volumePreset = this.volumePresets.find(val => val === newVal) ?? null;
    },
  },
  methods: {
    onFlowrateToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.flowrate = val;
      }
    },
    onVolumeToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.volume = val;
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

name: Focus
format:
<template>

    <!-- Focus Distance Slider -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="8">
        <v-slider
          v-model.number="distance"
          :max="max"
          :min="min"
          :step="25"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Distance"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="4">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="distance"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="m" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Preset Distances -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="distancePreset"
          divided
          shaped
          color="primary"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onDistanceToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in presetDistances"
            :key="'distance-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Directional Focus Control -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="focusDirection"
          color="primary"
          mandatory
          divided
          shaped
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
        >
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'left'">Left</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'stop'">Stop</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'right'">Right</v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      min: 25,
      max: 5000,
      distance: 25,
      distancePreset: null,
      presetDistances: [25, 150, 500, 5000],
      focusDirection: 'stop',
    };
  },
  watch: {
    distance(newVal) {
      const exactMatch = this.presetDistances.find((val) => val === newVal);
      this.distancePreset = exactMatch ?? null;
    },
  },
  methods: {
    onDistanceToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.distance = val;
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

</template>

      ledState: 'off',
    };
  },
};
</script>

name: Sample Information
Starting point
format:
<template>
  <v-container>
    <v-row>
      <!-- Date -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="6">
        <v-text-field
          label="Date"
          variant="outlined"
          placeholder="jj/mm/aaaa"
          type="date" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>

      <!-- Time -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="6">
        <v-text-field
          label="Time"
          variant="outlined"
          placeholder="--:--"
          type="time"
          density="compact" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
    <v-row>
      <!-- GPS Latitude -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="12">
        <v-row>
          <v-col cols="1"> Latitude </v-col>
          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="latitude_D"
              :min="0"
              :max="90"
              :step="1"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="latitude_M"
              :min="0"
              :max="59"
              :step="1"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="2">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="latitude_S"
              :min="0"
              :max="59.9999"
              :step="0.0001"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-select variant="outlined" :items="['N', 'S']" hide-details append-icon="mdi-information" />
          </v-col>

          <v-col cols="1"> Longitude </v-col>

          <!-- GPS Longitude -->

          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="longitude_D"
              :min="0"
              :max="180"
              :step="1"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="longitude_M"
              :min="0"
              :max="59"
              :step="1"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="2">
            <v-text-field
              v-model.number="longitude_S"
              :min="0"
              :max="59.9999"
              :step="0.0001"
              :model-value="0"
              type="number"
              variant="outlined"
              hide-details
            />
          </v-col>
          <v-col cols="1">
            <v-select :items="['E', 'W']" hide-details variant="outlined" append-icon="mdi-information" />
          </v-col>
        </v-row>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
  </v-container>
</template>

name: Net Specificity
format:
<template>
  <v-container>
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Mouth Opening Diameter"
          v-model="sample_net_mouth_diameter"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="cm"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          clearable
          hint="The diameter of the mouth (or opening) of the net used in sampling, measured in centimeters (cm)." append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Length of the Net"
          v-model="sample_net_length"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="cm"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          clearable
          hint="The length of the net used for sampling from the opening to the collector, measured in centimeters (cm). Measure from mouth to bottom of collector." append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Net mesh size"
          v-model="sample_net_mesh_size"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="m"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          clearable
          hint="The size of the mesh used in the net, measured in micrometers (m)." append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Volume of the collector"
          v-model="sample_collected_volume"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="mL"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          clearable
          hint="The volume of water collected after sampling, measured in milliliters (ml)." append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
        
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
  </v-container>
</template>
<script>
  export default {
    data: () => ({
      sample_net_mouth_diameter: 30,
      sample_net_length: 120,
      sample_net_mesh_size: 20,
      sample_collected_volume: 50
    }),
  }
</script>

<template>
  <v-card class="ma-20 pa-2">
    <v-row class="ma-20 pa-2">
      <v-col cols="12" sm="10">
        <v-slider
          v-model="slider"
          :max="max"
          :min="min"
          :step="0.2"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Label"
          :thumb-size="30"
        />
      </v-col>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="2">
        <v-text-field
          v-model="slider"
          prepend-inner-icon="mdi-information-outline"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="suffix"
          density="compact"
          @click:prepend-inner="showDialog = true"
        />
        <v-dialog v-model="showDialog" max-width="500px">
          <v-card>
            <v-card-title>Information</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>
              This is some additional information displayed in a dialog.
            </v-card-text>
            <v-card-actions>
              <v-btn text @click="showDialog = false">Close</v-btn>
            </v-card-actions>
          </v-card>
        </v-dialog>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
  export default {
    data() {
      return {
        showDialog: false, // Controls dialog visibility
        min: -50,
        max: 90,
        slider: 40,
      }
    },
  }
</script>

name: Vuetify links
content:
# Vuetify Resources and Examples

This document provides useful links and references for working with Vuetify components, icons, and examples.

## Vuetify Documentation
- **Component Usage**: Learn how to use components in Vuetify.  
  [View Documentation](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/components/all/#containment)

- **API Reference**: Explore the full API details for `v-field`.  
  [View API](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/api/v-field/)

## Icons
- **Material Design Icons**: Access the Material Design Icons (MDI) library for Vuetify projects.  
  [Explore Icons](https://pictogrammers.github.io/@mdi/font/2.0.46/)

## Code Playground
- **Vue Play**: Experiment with Vue.js and Vuetify components in an interactive playground.  
  [Open Playground](https://play.vuetifyjs.com/#)

name: Illustration of the Flow
content:
## Illustration of the Flow

### **1. UI Event**
**Node Name**: `UI Event`  
**Description**: Captures user events from the dashboard (e.g., page navigation).  
**Connected Dashboard**: `My Dashboard`.

```javascript
// Emits messages with the topic and page path when an event occurs.
```

---

### **2. Switch: `$pageview`**
**Node Name**: `msg.topic === "$pageview"`  
**Description**: Filters messages where `msg.topic` equals `$pageview`, ensuring only page navigation events are processed.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.topic === "$pageview";
```

---

### **3. Switch: `/load`**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path === "/load"`  
**Description**: Filters messages to pass only those where the page path matches `/load`.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.payload.page.path === "/load";
```

---

### **4. Debug**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path`  
**Description**: Outputs the value of `msg.payload.page.path` to the debug sidebar in Node-RED for monitoring purposes.

```javascript
// Outputs:
// msg.payload.page.path
```

---

## Supporting Details

- **Dashboard Base**: `My Dashboard`  
  - Accessible at `/dashboard`.  
  - Includes navigation and notification configurations for seamless user interaction.

---

format:
<template>
    <v-text-field
        label="My variable"
        variant="outlined"
        v-model="msg.variable"
      hide-details="auto"
        @update:model-value="send({ variable: msg.variable})"
    ></v-text-field>
</template>

name: get global variable
set global variable
Illustration of the Flow
content:
## Illustration of the Flow

### **1. Get Global Variable**
**Node Name**: `get global variable`  
**Description**: Retrieves a global variable (`variable`) stored in the Node-RED context.

```javascript
// Retrieve the global variable
msg.variable = global.get('variable');

return msg;
```

---

### **2. Template**
**Node Name**: `template`  
**Description**: Displays a Vue.js-based text field in the user interface, allowing the user to view and update the global variable.

```html
<template>
    <v-divider class="my-5"></v-divider>
    <v-text-field
        label="My variable"
        variant="outlined"
        v-model="msg.variable"
        @update:model-value="send({ variable: msg.variable })"
    ></v-text-field>
</template>
```

---

### **3. Set Global Variable**
**Node Name**: `set global variable`  
**Description**: Updates the global variable (`variable`) with the value entered in the UI text field.

```javascript
// Set a value in the global context
global.set('variable', msg.variable);

return msg;
```

---

## Supporting Details

- **UI Group**: `Value and payloads`  
  Groups the widgets under a dashboard section for better organization.

- **UI Page**: `Data in global.json`  
  Displays the group on a dashboard page accessible via the `/data` URL.

- **Theme**: `FairScope Theme`  
  Configures the visual style of the dashboard, using a clean and modern design with primary and background colors.

convert px to um
Histogram of equivalent_diameter
content:
### Distribution of Object Sizes  
Understanding the size distribution of planktonic objects helps identify dominant size classes and detect anomalies. A skewed distribution might indicate specific biological trends, such as a bloom of a particular species or a technical issue in the acquisition process.  

*In the graph:*  
- A **peak in smaller sizes** suggests dominance of tiny plankton.  
- A **broad distribution** indicates a mix of various size classes.  
- A **skewed or bimodal pattern** may reflect biological or technical factors (e.g., species-specific blooms or imaging biases).

name: elongation vs. area
content:
### Relationship Between Elongation and Object Area  
This scatter plot helps assess whether larger objects tend to be more elongated or compact. Certain plankton species have characteristic shapes, and identifying correlations between elongation and area can aid in distinguishing different taxa or understanding morphological variability.  

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Large and highly elongated objects (e.g., filamentous plankton).  
- **Bottom-right**: Small but highly elongated objects (e.g., thin needle-like forms). 
- **Top-left**: Large but compact objects (e.g., rounded or clustered plankton). 
- **Bottom-left**: Small and compact objects (e.g., spherical or short structures).

name: elongation vs. area
label: elongation vs. area
xAxisLabel: elongation (ratio of major to minor axis)

name: equivalent_diameter vs. MeanValue
content:
### Variation of Mean Brightness with Equivalent Diameter  
This graph explores whether larger objects tend to be brighter or darker. This can reveal differences in pigmentation, transparency, or even imaging inconsistencies.  

*In the graph:*   
- **Top-right**: Large and bright objects.
- **Top-left**: Small and bright objects.
- **Bottom-right**: Large and dark objects.
- **Bottom-left**: Small and dark objects.

name: MeanSaturation vs. MeanValue
content:
### Relationship Between Mean Saturation and Mean Brightness
This visualization helps understand how color properties vary with brightness. Some plankton groups exhibit distinct coloration, and saturation could be a useful feature for classification. A strong trend might suggest systematic differences in pigmentation or optical properties across plankton groups.

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Bright and highly saturated objects (vivid colors).  
- **Top-left**: Bright but low-saturation objects (pale or near-white).  
- **Bottom-right**: Dark but highly saturated objects (deep, rich colors).  
- **Bottom-left**: Dark and low-saturation objects (grayish or faintly colored).

command: echo -n "["; first=1; for f in data/export/ecotaxa/ecotaxa_*.zip; do ts=$(basename "$f" | sed -E 's/ecotaxa_([0-9]{4})_([0-9]{2})_([0-9]{2})_([0-9]{2})_([0-9]{2})_([0-9]{2})\.zip/\1-\2-\3 \4:\5:\6/'); ts_ms=$(date -d "$ts" +%s000); sz=$(stat -c%s "$f"); [ $first -eq 1 ] && first=0 || echo -n ","; echo -n "{\"myTime\":$ts_ms,\"size\":$sz}"; done; echo "]"

          class="text-center py-2"
        >
          <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-eyedropper-variant</v-icon>
          <v-card-title class="text-h6">White Balance</v-card-title>
          <v-card-text>
            Use the color picker to measure the current color values and adjust the white balance accordingly.
          </v-card-text>
        </v-card>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Step 2: Lightness -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-card
          href="calibration_lightness"
          target="_blank"
          class="text-center py-2"
        >
          <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-brightness-6</v-icon>
          <v-card-title class="text-h6">Lightness</v-card-title>
          <v-card-text>
            Measure the current lightness value and update the LED intensity or ISO if below optimal levels.
          </v-card-text>
        </v-card>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Step 3: Pixel Size -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-card
          href="calibration_pixel_size"
          target="_blank"
          class="text-center py-2"
        >
          <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-ruler</v-icon>
          <v-card-title class="text-h6">Pixel Size</v-card-title>
          <v-card-text>
            Place markers on the micrometric ruler image to calculate the pixel size in microns per pixel.
          </v-card-text>
        </v-card>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Step 4: Pump Calibration -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-card
          href="calibration_pump"
          target="_blank"
          class="text-center py-2"
        >
          <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-water-pump</v-icon>
          <v-card-title class="text-h6">Pump Calibration</v-card-title>
          <v-card-text>
            Measure the transferred volume and adjust pump steps to improve accuracy in fluid handling.
          </v-card-text>
        </v-card>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
  </v-container>
</template>

name: Streaming
2. Measure the Current Saturation Level
3. Display White Balance Settings
format:
<template>
  <v-card title="3. Observe the current White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      <canvas id="wbChart"></canvas>
    </v-card-text>
  </v-card>
</template>



<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      chart: null,
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.$nextTick(() => {
      this.createChart(); // Initialize the chart after the component is fully mounted
    });
  },
  beforeDestroy() {
    if (this.chart) {
      this.chart.destroy(); // Clean up the chart if the component is destroyed
    }
  },
  methods: {
    createChart(hexColor = '#000000') {
      const canvas = document.getElementById('wbChart');
      if (!canvas) {
        console.error("Canvas element not found.");
        return;
      }

      const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
      if (!ctx) {
        console.error("Unable to get canvas context.");
        return;
      }

      const ratios = this.calculateRatiosFromHex(hexColor);

      if (this.chart) {
        this.chart.destroy(); // Ensure any existing chart is destroyed before creating a new one
      }

      this.chart = new Chart(ctx, {
        type: 'scatter',
        data: {
          datasets: [
            {
              label: 'Current WB',
              data: [{ x: ratios.bgRatio, y: ratios.rgRatio }],
              backgroundColor: 'blue',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 10,
              pointHoverRadius: 15,
            },
            {
              label: 'Acceptable WB',
              data: [{ x: 1, y: 1 }],
              backgroundColor: '#5cd65c',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 50,
              pointHoverRadius: 55,
              pointStyle: 'circle',
              fill: true,
              showLine: false,
            },
          ],
        },
        options: {
          responsive: true,
          maintainAspectRatio: true,
          scales: {
            x: {
              type: 'linear',
              position: 'bottom',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'B/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
            y: {
              type: 'linear',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'R/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
          },
          plugins: {
            legend: {
              display: true,
            },
          },
          animation: {
            duration: 0, // Disabling animations might prevent some update issues
          },
        },
      });
    },
    calculateRatiosFromHex(hex) {
      const r = parseInt(hex.slice(1, 3), 16);
      const g = parseInt(hex.slice(3, 5), 16);
      const b = parseInt(hex.slice(5, 7), 16);

      const rgRatio = r / g || 0;
      const bgRatio = b / g || 0;

      return { rgRatio, bgRatio };
    },
  },
  watch: {
    msg(newMsg) {
      if (newMsg && newMsg.acq_wb_hex) {
        this.createChart(newMsg.acq_wb_hex);
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
#wbChart {
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 400px !important;
}
</style>

name: 4. Adjust White Balance Settings
format:
<template>
  <v-card title="4. Adjust White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      Use the suggested values to adjust the white balance based on the color input.
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-text>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4"></v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Current</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Suggested</v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWRed</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWRed" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWRed" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWBlue</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWBlue" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWBlue" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-actions>
    <v-card-text>
      We have calculated better values for your AWRed and AWBlue : 
    </v-card-text>
      <v-btn color="primary" @click="sendSettings" variant="outlined">Improve</v-btn>
    </v-card-actions>
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ['id'],
  data() {
    return {
      currentAWRed: '',
      currentAWBlue: '',
      suggestedAWRed: '',
      suggestedAWBlue: '',
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.setupSocketListeners();
  },
  methods: {
    setupSocketListeners() {
      if (this.$socket) {
        this.$socket.on('msg-input:' + this.id, (msg) => {
          if (msg.acq_wb_red !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWRed = msg.acq_wb_red;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_blue !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWBlue = msg.acq_wb_blue;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_hex !== undefined) {
            this.calculateSuggestedAW(msg.acq_wb_hex);
          }
        });
      }
    },
    hexToRgb(hex) {
      hex = hex.replace(/^#/, '');
      let bigint = parseInt(hex, 16);
      let r = (bigint >> 16) & 255;
      let g = (bigint >> 8) & 255;
      let b = bigint & 255;
      return { r, g, b };
    },
    calculateSuggestedAW(hexColor) {
      const { r, g, b } = this.hexToRgb(hexColor);
      let redAdjustment = (g - r) + parseInt(this.currentAWRed, 10);
      let blueAdjustment = (g - b) + parseInt(this.currentAWBlue, 10);
      this.suggestedAWRed = Math.max(0, redAdjustment);
      this.suggestedAWBlue = Math.max(0, blueAdjustment);
    },
    sendSettings() {
      const payload = {
        payload: {
          action: "settings",
          settings: {
            white_balance_gain: {
              blue: this.suggestedAWBlue,
              red: this.suggestedAWRed,
            },
          },
        },
        acq_wb_blue:this.suggestedAWBlue,
        acq_wb_red:this.suggestedAWRed,
        
        topic: "imager/image",
        
      };
      this.send(payload);
    },
  },
};
</script>

Histogram of equivalent_diameter
content:
### Distribution of Object Sizes  
Understanding the size distribution of planktonic objects helps identify dominant size classes and detect anomalies. A skewed distribution might indicate specific biological trends, such as a bloom of a particular species or a technical issue in the acquisition process.  

*In the graph:*  
- A **peak in smaller sizes** suggests dominance of tiny plankton.  
- A **broad distribution** indicates a mix of various size classes.  
- A **skewed or bimodal pattern** may reflect biological or technical factors (e.g., species-specific blooms or imaging biases).

name: elongation vs. area
content:
### Relationship Between Elongation and Object Area  
This scatter plot helps assess whether larger objects tend to be more elongated or compact. Certain plankton species have characteristic shapes, and identifying correlations between elongation and area can aid in distinguishing different taxa or understanding morphological variability.  

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Large and highly elongated objects (e.g., filamentous plankton).  
- **Bottom-right**: Small but highly elongated objects (e.g., thin needle-like forms). 
- **Top-left**: Large but compact objects (e.g., rounded or clustered plankton). 
- **Bottom-left**: Small and compact objects (e.g., spherical or short structures).

name: elongation vs. area
label: elongation vs. area
xAxisLabel: elongation (ratio of major to minor axis)

name: equivalent_diameter vs. MeanValue
content:
### Variation of Mean Brightness with Equivalent Diameter  
This graph explores whether larger objects tend to be brighter or darker. This can reveal differences in pigmentation, transparency, or even imaging inconsistencies.  

*In the graph:*   
- **Top-right**: Large and bright objects.
- **Top-left**: Small and bright objects.
- **Bottom-right**: Large and dark objects.
- **Bottom-left**: Small and dark objects.

name: MeanSaturation vs. MeanValue
content:
### Relationship Between Mean Saturation and Mean Brightness
This visualization helps understand how color properties vary with brightness. Some plankton groups exhibit distinct coloration, and saturation could be a useful feature for classification. A strong trend might suggest systematic differences in pigmentation or optical properties across plankton groups.

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Bright and highly saturated objects (vivid colors).  
- **Top-left**: Bright but low-saturation objects (pale or near-white).  
- **Bottom-right**: Dark but highly saturated objects (deep, rich colors).  
- **Bottom-left**: Dark and low-saturation objects (grayish or faintly colored).
